file.title: AMM PART II-1285 - CHAPTER 33-30-01-04 - COMPARTMENT LIGHT ASSEMBLY LAMP - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION

page.data: AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL COMPARTMENT LIGHT ASSEMBLY LAMP - REMOVAL/INSTALLATION EFFECTIVITY: ALL 1. General A. This section gives the procedures to remove/install the lamp of the light assemblies installed in: • Nose Landing Gear Compartment • Forward Electronic Compartment • Control Rigging Compartment • Fuel/Defuel control panel Compartment • Rear Electronic Compartment • Tail Cone Compartment B. The procedures in this section are given in the sequence below. The tasks identified with ( ♦) are part of the Scheduled Maintenance Requirements Document (SMRD). TASK NUMBER DESCRIPTION EFFECTIVITY COMPARTMENT LIGHT ASSEMBLY ALL 33-30-01-000-801-A LAMP - REMOVAL (TYPICAL) COMPARTMENT LIGHT ASSEMBLY ALL 33-30-01-400-801-A LAMP - INSTALLATION (TYPICAL) EMB-145 - AMM 1285 General 33-30-01 Page 1 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-30-01-000-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 2. COMPARTMENT LIGHT ASSEMBLY LAMP - REMOVAL (TYPICAL) A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to remove the compartment light assembly lamps installed in the compartments included on the list above. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM SDS 24-60-00/1 C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 113/114 Nose Landing Gear Compartment 213/214 113CZ Forward Electronic Compartment 123/124 123BL Control Rigging Compartment 191 191BR Fuel/Defuel Control Panel Compartment 271/272 272DR Rear Electronic Compartment 311/312 312AR Tail Cone Compartment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Cockpit ceiling I. Preparation SUBTASK 841-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, open the COMPT circuit breaker (Location Tip: DC BUS 2/LIGHTS/COMPT) and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to it. (2) On the RH electrical-power control/distribution box (AMM SDS 24-60-00/1), open the COMPT circuit breaker (Location Tip: RB SERVBUS/COMPT LT) and attach a DO- NOT-CLOSE tag to it. EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-30-01 Page 2 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL (3) Do this item for the relamping of the fuel/defuel control panel light assembly. (a) On the circuit breaker panel, open the REFUELING 1 circuit breaker and attach a DO-NOT-CLOSE tag to it. (4) Gain access to the related compartment. J. Removal (Figure 401) SUBTASK 020-002-A (1) Loosen the screws (3) and remove the protective lens (2) and gasket (1). (2) Remove the lamp (4). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-30-01 Page 3 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

GASKET 4. LAMP 2. PROTECTIVE LENS 3. SCREW DET. A 145AMM330066.MCE A EMB-145 - AMM 1285 000-801-A/400 33-30-01 Page 4 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL TASK 33-30-01-400-801-A EFFECTIVITY: ALL 3. COMPARTMENT LIGHT ASSEMBLY LAMP - INSTALLATION (TYPICAL) A. General (1) This task gives the procedures to install the compartment light assembly lamp. B. References REFERENCE DESIGNATION AMM SDS 24-60-00/1 BAGGAGE AND SERVICE COMPARTMENT LIGHTS - AMM TASK 33-30-00-700-801-A/500 OPERATIONAL TEST C. Zones and Accesses ZONE PANEL/DOOR LOCATION 113/114 Nose Landing Gear Compartment 213/214 113CZ Forward Electronic Compartment 123/124 123BL Control Rigging Compartment 191 191BR Fuel/Defuel Control Panel Compartment 271/272 272DR Rear Electronic Compartment 311/312 312AR Tail Cone Compartment D. Tools and Equipment Not Applicable E. Auxiliary Items Not Applicable F. Consumable Materials Not Applicable G. Expandable Parts Not Applicable H. Persons Recommended QTY FUNCTION PLACE 1 Does the task Where applicable I. Installation (Figure 401) SUBTASK 420-002-A (1) Install the lamp (4). (2) Install the gasket (1) and the protective lens (2). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 33-30-01 Page 5 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.

AIRCRAFT MAINTENANCE MANUAL J. Follow-on SUBTASK 842-002-A (1) On the circuit breaker panel, close the COMPT circuit breaker (Location Tip: DC BUS 2/LIGHTS/COMPT) and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from it. (2) On the RH electrical-power control/distribution box (AMM SDS 24-60-00/1), close the COMPT circuit breaker (Location Tip: RB SERVBUS/COMPT LT) and remove the DO- NOT-CLOSE tag from it. (3) On the circuit breaker panel, close the REFUELING 1 circuit breaker and remove the DO-NOT-CLOSE tag from it, if applicable. (4) Do the operational test of the replaced light ( AMM TASK 33-30-00-700-801-A/500). EMB-145 - AMM 1285 400-801-A/400 33-30-01 Page 6 of 6 Rev 48 - Oct 30/15 Copyright ÃÂ© by Embraer S.A. All rights reserved - See title page for details.
